Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. This value is managed by check constraint and may onlybe equal to the name of one of the valid subtypes. Please note that FACILITY_TYPEwill eventually become a SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: RESTRICTION ID: Unique identifier for the restriction.
Column Comment.3: RESTRICTION VERSION: The version number of the restriction. In some areas,changes to the detailed requirements of a restriction result in versioning.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: DESCRIPTION: A textual description of the surface restriction, as found in theregulatory documentation.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date that the restriction first came into effect. Start and enddates for individual cycles are tracked as START and END DATE.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: general remark about the surface restriction. Detailed remarks may betracked in the table LD SURF REST REMARK.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.13: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.15: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
